document_data.name: The Count of Duskmere
document_data.deathnotes: casualty of raid by forces of [[Orchtrien]]
document_data.mainbody: The '''Count of Duskmere''' was an [[elven]] nobleman of the [[Time of Dragons]], living in the 25{{th}} millennium before [[Dalereckoning]].
document_data.Activities: Among his activities as a minor ruler, he engaged in much treason.
document_data.Relationships: He was the father of [[Winterflower Duskmere]], and the head of House [[Duskmere]].{{cite book/Realms of the Elves/Traitors|5}}
document_data.History:
In the year {{yearlink|-25090}}, the [[elven]] house of Duskmere was involved in a treasonous attempt to strike at the forces of King [[Orchtrien]] of [[Dawnfire]]. These rebel forces almost won, but were personally routed by Prince [[Bexendral]], who ''[[teleport]]ed'' to their aid. To punish the elves for their treachery, King Orchtrien had them send their sons to his court, where they would be educated and serve as hostages to ensure no more treachery was attempted. One of the hostages he sent was Lady Winterflower Duskmere, his own daughter.

Later, his daughter returned to their forest, carrying a trove of the King's [[spellbook]]s. The King hid her and his court at a secret stronghold in response, biding some time to read the spellbooks.{{cite book/Realms of the Elves/Traitors|55}} However, the stronghold was found by Orchtrien's forces, which came in Winterflower's pursuit.{{cite book/Realms of the Elves/Traitors|61}} The stronghold was razed; the Count was almost certainly slain in the battle.
